kdtree_demo

PURPOSE

% Demo of the KDTREE and KDTREEIDX function.

SYNOPSIS

This is a script file.

DESCRIPTION 

% Demo of the KDTREE and KDTREEIDX function.
%
%   Guy Shechter
%   guy at jhu dot edu
%   June 2004

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

SOURCE CODE 

0001 %% Demo of the KDTREE and KDTREEIDX function.
0002 %%
0003 %%   Guy Shechter
0004 %%   guy at jhu dot edu
0005 %%   June 2004
0006 
0007 %% Generate a set of 10000 reference datapoints in R^5
0008 ReferencePts = rand(10000,5); 
0009 
0010 %%% Build the k-d Tree once from the reference datapoints.
0011 [tmp, tmp, TreeRoot] = kdtree( ReferencePts, []);
0012 
0013 for Iteration = 1:10
0014 
0015   disp(sprintf('Iteration %3d: ',Iteration));
0016   
0017   %% Generate a random test set of 100 points in R^5
0018   TestPoints = rand(100, 5);
0019 
0020   %% Find the closest point in ReferencePts for each random TestPoint
0021   [ ClosestPts, DistA, TreeRoot ] = kdtree([], TestPoints, ...
0022                            TreeRoot);
0023 
0024   %% Find the row index of the closest point in ReferencePts for
0025   %each random TestPoint
0026   [ ClosestPtIndex, DistB, TreeRoot ] = kdtreeidx([], TestPoints, ...
0027                           TreeRoot);
0028     
0029   %% Are the two solutions equivalent?
0030   IndexedPts = ReferencePts(ClosestPtIndex,:);
0031   if sum(sum(abs([ IndexedPts - ClosestPts ]))) == 0
0032     disp('KDTREE and KDTREEIDX found the same set of closest points');
0033   end
0034   
0035 end
0036 
0037 %%% Free the k-D Tree from memory.
0038 kdtree([],[],TreeRoot);
0039 
0040
